title: Four-year-old girl dies after falling into canal in Kotagala
byline: A four-year-old girl has died after falling into a canal near a house in the Rosita Estate in Dimbula Pathana, police stated.

title: Sri Lanka President urged to intervene in Thailand–Cambodia dispute
byline: A request has been made to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake to intervene as a mediator in order to peacefully resolve the ongoing tensions between Thailand and Cambodia.

title: A/L Exam top achievers to be felicitated by President’s Fund in Batticaloa
byline: The Eastern Province ceremony of the President’s Fund A/L Excellence Awards organized to recognize district-level top achievers of the 2023/2024 G.C.E. Advanced Level Examination will be held today (27) at the Swami Vipulananda Faculty of Fine Arts in Batticaloa.

title: Thailand, Cambodia agree to hold immediate ceasefire talks
byline: US President Donald Trump has announced that Thailand and Cambodia have agreed to an “immediate ceasefire” over violent conflict at their borders.

title: Tourist arrivals in July top 145,000
byline: A total of 145,188 tourists have arrived in the country thus far in July, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.

title: Four including a female arrested over assault on bus driver in Kandy
byline: A total of four individuals have been arrested by the Kandy Police in connection with the assault on a bus driver who was transporting schoolchildren in Hantana, Kandy on Friday (25), police stated.

title: Several spells of showers expected today
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central and North-western provinces and in the Galle and Matara districts today (27), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Passengers exit American Airlines flight via emergency slide after aborted takeoff
byline: An American Airlines flight was forced to abort takeoff at the Denver airport on Saturday after a landing gear malfunction led to fire and smoke on the runway.

title: Walmart stabbing in Michigan leaves 11 injured
byline: At least 11 people have been injured in a stabbing at a Walmart supermarket in Michigan, authorities say.

title: Sri Lanka calls for peaceful dialogue on Cambodia–Thailand border clashes
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka has called for a peaceful resolution to the recent clashes along the Cambodia–Thailand border, according to a statement issued by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism in Colombo.

title: Social spending, protecting vulnerable an indicative target in IMF program – SL Mission Chief
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has underscored the importance of sustaining Sri Lanka’s reform momentum and safeguarding macroeconomic stability, following a week-long mission to the country.

title: 809 schools designated as ‘national schools’ in name only – COPA reveals
byline: It has been revealed during a meeting of the Committee on Public Accounts (COPA) that a sum of over Rs. 2.4 million has been spent solely on name boards to designate 809 provincial schools as national schools.

title: Trump says he is seeking a ceasefire between Thailand, Cambodia
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Saturday he was calling the leaders of Cambodia and Thailand to press for a ceasefire as fighting along the border continued into a third day.

title: Four including cops arrested for killing pregnant deer remanded
byline: The four suspects, including two Police Sergeants, who were arrested in connection with the killing of a pregnant deer within the Heenugala Reserve at Makulugaswewa, Galewela, have been remanded until August 01 by the Dambulla Magistrate’s Court.

title: Govt to launch ‘Think Tank’ for rural economic revitalization, says PM
byline: Prime Minister of Sri Lanka, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the government will initiate steps to establish a National Industrial Planning Think Tank centered on revitalizing the rural economy and the necessary technical, scientific, and advisory support would be provided through that initiative to strengthen businesses across Sri Lanka.

title: More details revealed in pregnant deer killing incident involving police officers
byline: Police have uncovered more details during the interrogation of suspects arrested in connection with the illegal killing of a pregnant deer that was pregnant in the Makulugaswewa area of the Heenugala Reserve, Galewela.

title: Nine killed in courthouse attack in Iran’s Sistan-Baluchestan province
byline: At least nine people were killed in an armed attack by the Sunni Jaish al-Adl Baluch group on a courthouse in Iran’s restive Sistan-Baluchestan province on Saturday, including three of the assailants, state media reported.

title: Police arrest 4 suspects connected to Lalith Kannangara’s drug network
byline: Four individuals allegedly connected to the drug trafficking operations of ‘Bus Laliya’, also known as Lalith Kannangara — a Dubai-based figure believed to be running a Sri Lankan organized crime network — have been arrested in possession of crystal methamphetamine (commonly known as ‘ICE’).

title: World AI conference opens in Shanghai with record scale
byline: Featuring the theme of “Global Solidarity in the AI Era,” the 2025 World AI Conference & High-level Meeting on Global AI Governance opened on Saturday in east China’s Shanghai Municipality.

title: Navy arrests 65 for engaging in illegal fishing activities
byline: In a series of separate operations conducted within nearly two weeks between 09 and 22 July, the Sri Lanka Navy has apprehended a total of 65 individuals involved in various illegal fishing activities across multiple locations around the island.

title: Almost a third of people in Gaza not eating for days, UN food programme warns
byline: Almost one in three people in the Gaza Strip are going for days without eating, the UN’s food aid programme has warned.

title: 21 wild elephants shot recently; special probe initiated – Dy Minster
byline: Deputy Minister of Environment Anton Jayakody stated that a total of 21 wild elephants have been shot in recent days, prompting the launch of a special investigation into the incidents, as similar occurrences are being reported across the country.

title: Sri Lankan woman loses Kuwaiti citizenship over major identity scam and fake pregnancy
byline: A Sri Lankan woman has made headlines in Kuwait after authorities uncovered a 33-year-long fraud in which she deceived a Kuwaiti man, faked a pregnancy, and illegally obtained Kuwaiti citizenship.

title: Number of skeletal remains uncovered from Chemmani mass grave increases to 101
byline: Skeletal remains believed to belong to 11 more individuals have been recovered from the Chemmani Sindhubathi cemetery, located near a suspected mass grave site in Jaffna.

title: Brigadier F. Joseph assumes duties as Defence Ministry spokesman
byline: Brigadier Franklin Joseph USP has officially assumed duties as the new Director Media and Spokesman of the Ministry of Defence.

title: Israeli military says it will pause fighting in 3 areas of Gaza to address surging hunger
byline: The Israeli military said Sunday it would begin a “tactical pause” in fighting in three areas of Gaza as part of steps to address a worsening humanitarian situation.

title: 21 arrested with drugs at party organised through social media
byline: A total of 21 individuals have been taken into custody along with drugs during a raid conducted at a party which was organized through social media in Welivita, Kaduwela, police stated.

title: Turkey records all-time high temperature of 50.5 degrees celsius
byline: Turkey’s environment ministry has stated that meteorologists had registered a reading of 50.5C in the southeast of the country, a nationwide record.

title: Police denies withdrawal of security granted to senior monk in Eastern Province
byline: The Sri Lanka Police have issued a statement regarding a social media post claiming that the security provided to a senior Buddhist monk in the Eastern Province has been withdrawn.

title: Astronomer hires Chris Martin’s ex-wife Gwyneth Paltrow as spokesperson after kiss cam scandal
byline: Astronomer – the company whose CEO resigned after being caught on a KissCam at a Coldplay rock concert embracing a woman who was not his wife – is trying to move on from the drama with someone who knows the band pretty well.

title: 24 persons nabbed during special operation in Galle
byline: A total of twenty-four suspects have been arrested in a special search operation carried out in several areas of Galle.

title: Justice Preethi Padman Surasena Sworn in as 49th Chief Justice of Sri Lanka
byline: Justice Preethi Padman Surasena, the most senior Supreme Court Justice, was sworn in as the new Chief Justice of Sri Lanka this morning (27) at the Presidential Secretariat, before President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Air India releases compensation to 166 families of AI171 crash
byline: Air India has announced that it has paid insurance relief compensation to the families of 166 victims of the Ahmedabad plane crash last month.

title: World’s No. 1 stunt kite team to feature at Derana International Kite Festival
byline: The world’s number one stunt kite team, the Three Wind Kite Team from Wuhan, China, will take part in the Derana-Signal Colombo International Kite Festival.

title: Sri Lanka’s Cardinal Ranjith opposes same-sex marriage concept
byline: Archbishop of Colombo His Eminence Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith has reiterated the importance of safeguarding the traditional family unit while strongly opposing the same-sex marriage concept.

title: Three-wheeler topples into canal in Dimbula Pathana
byline: A three-wheeler traveling from Dimbula Pathana to Hatton veered off the road and toppled into the Devon Canal, police stated.

title: Sri Lanka reaffirms commitment to strengthening ties with Singapore
byline: Sri Lanka’s Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath has reaffirmed the country’s commitment to further advancing bilateral relations with Singapore.

title: Govt to set up 2,000 primary care centres nationwide in next 3 years
byline: The Ministry of Health and Mass Media announced that Primary Care Community Centers will be established islandwide, with each center expected to serve nearly 10,000 people from the country’s population to provide more efficient and higher-quality primary health care services.

title: Two fishermen rescued after boat capsizes in seas off Mirissa
byline: The Sri Lanka Coast Guard (SLCG) has successfully rescued two fishermen who were in distress after their fishing vessel capsized due to rough seas off the southern coast near Mirissa today (July 27).

title: Over 1,100 arrested for drug-related offenses in island-wide operation
byline: A total of 1,182 individuals have been arrested in connection with drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday (26) by the Sri Lanka Police, the Police Special Task Force (STF), and the Tri-Forces.

title: Education reform is about systemic change, not just textbooks, says PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that educational reform is not merely about the introduction of a new textbook, but a transformation of the entire system.

title: Thailand and Cambodia agree to Malaysian mediation, Malaysian minister says
byline: Thailand and Cambodia have agreed to Malaysia acting as a mediator in their border conflict, the Malaysian Foreign Minister said on Sunday, as the combatants each said the other had launched further artillery attacks across contested areas.

title: Two women killed, 4 injured in crash on expressway
byline: Two females have reportedly been killed while four others remain injured after a van crashed due to a burst tyre near the 175th km post at Angunukolapelessa on the Southern Expressway, police said.

title: Three Maradana police officers interdicted over drug links
byline: Three Police Constables (PCs) attached to the Maradana Police Station have been interdicted after being found to have maintained links with drug traffickers, the police said.
